span.span: Kindergarten Screening is postponed. More information will be coming soon.

span.div: Bridgeport Exempted Village Schools was recently awarded the Fidelity Award from the International Alliance for Invitational Education.

During the 2011-2012 School Year, the district was awarded the International Alliance Invitational Award. That year the staff came together to evaluate the district environment to ensure that the schools were inviting places for students, staff and the community. Last year the DLT came together to re-evaluate and update the district climate goals which led to appling for the Fidelity Award. This award recognizes schools that have continued to be intentionally inviting places.

div.span: Pay Schools has made their system easier and faster for your convenience and ease of use.

span.p: A longtime program is bridging the gap between students at Bridgeport Exempted Village Schools.

p.span: The Bridgeport Exempted Village School District is now providing free breakfasts to students to ensure they are fueled up for learning.

div.span: Bridgeport Schools has partnered with Southeast Healthcare to provide physical healthcare services

span.div: The Bridgeport Exempted Village Schools District offers Pay Schools Central, a secure payment systems to enable parents to fund lunch accounts and to pay fees online.

div.span: The Bridgeport Exempted Village School continues to offer a safety service called School Hotline.

div.span: Download the school district app to stay up-to-date with school news and announcements and to keep track of upcoming events.

span.p: Bridgeport Exempted Village School District is pleased to assist you in the online enrollment process. If you have a valid email address, please follow the steps below.

Step 1: To enroll your child, please click here to create a new account and to complete the online registration forms. *Please note this does NOT complete the registration process. Please continue with the steps below. *If you are a Bridgeport resident enrolled in another school district, please create an account, but DO NOT enroll as a new student. Please call the school to speak to the central registrar to receive your child's student number.
Step 2: Bring your child's required documentation to the school.

p.strong: For a List of Required Registration Documents, (Click Here)

span.p: Step 3: Once all required documents are received and your child is approved for enrollment, follow the directions (Attached).

span.div: New students interested in applying for Open Enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year should follow the steps for new student enrollment. Please choose Open Enrollment as the Enrollment Type.

Current students who are Open Enrolled and want to apply for Open Enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year must log in to their online account and fill out the Open Enrollment Application. Please complete this process by May 1st, 2020.

Applications from students from other Ohio districts who are not currently enrolled will not be considered until the third full week of May. Applications will be considered on a first-come, first-served basis with an assurance that native students will not be displaced. All applications will be acted on by June 15.
Open Enrollment is accepted in accordance with the district's policies and guidelines.

div.strong: The deadline to accept Open Enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year is September 12, 2020.
